election_record.label: Massachusetts 1820 Constitutional Convention President

overview.note: "The same committee was directed to collect the ballots for President of the Convention; and they reported, that the whole number taken was 352; and that the Honorable John Adams had 335 votes." Columbian Centinel. American Federalist (Boston, MA). November 18, 1820.
In a speech to the Convention, John Adams, citing his age, declined the appointment as President of the Convention.

election_record.reference: Columbian Centinel. American Federalist (Boston, MA). November 18, 1820.
